commands.name: Link
commands.description: Link your console gaming account to your Discord.

steps: Use /link command
Select your console (Xbox or Playstation)
Enter your console account name
Wait for confirmation of link
tutorial.notes: Can be used in #commands or #newcomerChat channels. Helper+ can link accounts for other users.

Helper Options.link-to: Optional: @mention user to link account to

Helper Options.Permission: Only Helpers can link accounts for others

commands.name: Ban
commands.description: Gameserver ban commands for managing player bans.

steps: Use /ban followed by one of these subcommands: add, remove, info, or appeal
For banning: /ban add <player> <reason> [minutes]
For unbanning: /ban remove <player>
For ban info: /ban info <player>
For appealing auto-bans: /ban appeal
tutorial.notes: Rookie moderators can only ban for up to 24 hours (1440 minutes). Higher roles can issue permanent bans.

Subcommands.add: Add a player to the banlist (requires player name/mention, reason, and optional duration)

Subcommands.remove: Remove a player from the banlist (Staff+ only)

Subcommands.info: Get information about an existing ban

Subcommands.appeal: Appeal your ban if you were auto-banned

Usage Limits.Channels: Can only be used in #commands and #ban-appeals channels

Usage Limits.Auto-ban Appeals: Only works for automatic PvP-related bans

Ban Options.Duration: Specify minutes (0 or omit for permanent - Moderator+ only)

Ban Options.Multiple Players: Can ban multiple players using commas

Ban Options.Victim Bans: Players can ban their killers if killed outside PvP zones

commands.name: Coin Calculator
commands.description: Convert coin to USD.

steps: Use /coin-calculator followed by the amount of coins
Enter the amount of coins you want to convert
The bot will show you the USD equivalent
Optional: Visit coin.spyzfeed.xyz to purchase coins
tutorial.notes: This command can only be used in the commands channel.

Usage.Channel Restriction: Can only be used in #commands channel

Options.amount: The number of coins to convert (required)

Response.Format: Shows coin amount and USD equivalent

Response.Visibility: Response is only visible to the command user

Response.Purchase Link: Includes link to coin purchase website

commands.name: Commands
commands.description: View information on all of the commands.

steps: Type /commands in any channel
View the list of all available commands
Use the dropdown menu to select a specific command for detailed information
Browse through command options and descriptions
tutorial.notes: The command menu will expire after 120 seconds of inactivity. Only commands you have permission to use will be shown.

Features.All Commands View: Shows a complete list of available commands

Features.Detailed View: Provides in-depth information about specific commands

Features.Interactive Menu: Dropdown menu for easy command navigation

Features.Permission Based: Only shows commands you have access to

Menu Options.All Commands: View the complete list of commands

Menu Options.Individual Commands: Select specific commands for detailed information

Display Information.Command Name: Shows the command name and description

Display Information.Options: Lists all available options for each command

Display Information.Subcommands: Displays nested command options if available

Display Information.Choices: Shows available choices for applicable options

Response Format.Embed: Information is displayed in a formatted embed

Response Format.Visibility: Response is only visible to the command user

commands.name: Faction
commands.description: Manage your faction.

steps: Use /faction to view all factions or your faction details
Select from available options in the dropdown menu
Follow the prompts to manage your faction
Changes will be logged in the faction log channel
tutorial.notes: Some options require specific faction ranks. Menu expires after 120 seconds of inactivity.

Member Commands.Kick: Remove members from faction (requires kick permission)

Response Format.Display: Shows faction information in embedded format

Response Format.Logging: All changes are logged in faction channel

Response Format.Visibility: Responses are ephemeral (only visible to command user)

commands.name: Friends
commands.description: Manage your in-game friends list.

steps: Use /friends followed by a subcommand
Choose add, remove, or list to manage your friends
For adding/removing, @mention the desired user
View your complete friends list with the list subcommand
tutorial.notes: This command can only be used in the commands channel. Friends list shows Discord, Xbox, and PSN information.

Subcommands.add: Add a player to your friends list (@mention required)

Subcommands.remove: Remove a player from your friends list (@mention required)

Subcommands.list: View your complete friends list with platform details

Usage Limits.Channel Restriction: Can only be used in #commands channel

Usage Limits.Visibility: Responses are only visible to command user

Response Format.Invalid User: Error message if user not found

commands.name: Leaders
commands.description: View various server leaderboards.

steps: Use /leaders to open the leaderboard menu
Select a category from the dropdown menu
View top 25 players for selected category
Use menu to switch between different leaderboards
tutorial.notes: Menu expires after 120 seconds. All leaderboards show top 25 players.

PVP Statistics.Times Knocked Out: Most times knocked out by players

commands.name: Location
commands.description: Get player's last known location or request location updates.

steps: Use /location to see your current location
Optional: Use 'updated' option for DM updates
Choose between player or item fold location updates
Staff can check other players' locations using target option
tutorial.notes: Location updates are sent via DM after the next log update. Staff can check multiple players using commas.

Basic Options.updated: Request DM notification of next location update

Staff Features.Permission: Requires Staff role to use target option

Response Format.Visibility: Responses are ephemeral (only visible to command user)

commands.name: Lottery
commands.description: Purchase tickets for daily and weekly lottery drawings.

steps: Use /lottery to purchase tickets
Receive both daily and weekly tickets
View current jackpot amounts
Check your remaining daily ticket purchases
tutorial.notes: Limited to 3 tickets per day. Drawings occur at 12AM EST. Requires cooldown between purchases.

Ticket Information.Daily Ticket: 75% of ticket price goes to daily jackpot

Ticket Information.Weekly Ticket: 25% of ticket price goes to weekly jackpot

Ticket Information.Cost: Set coin amount per ticket pair

Jackpot Details.Updates: Jackpot amounts update after each purchase

Response Format.Embed: Shows ticket numbers and jackpot amounts

commands.name: Redeem
commands.description: Redeem a one-time code for coin rewards.

steps: Use /redeem followed by your code
Enter the redemption code exactly as provided
Wait for confirmation message
Receive coin reward if code is valid
tutorial.notes: Codes can only be used once. Command must be used in #commands channel.

Usage.Visibility: Responses are ephemeral (only visible to you)

Code Types.One-Time Use: Each code can only be redeemed once

Response Format.Already Used: Indicates if code was previously redeemed

Response Format.Logging: Transactions logged in coin transactions channel

Transaction Details.Server Log: Records which server code was used in

commands.name: Roulette
commands.description: Play roulette with your coin.

steps: Use /roulette followed by your bet amount
Select a color to bet on:
- Red (1.5x multiplier)
- Black (2x multiplier)
- Green (5x multiplier)
Wait for the result to see if you won
tutorial.notes: Maximum bet is 250 coin. Has cooldown between plays. Must be used in #workGamble channel.

Game Rules.Balance Check: Cannot bet more than owned coin

Response Format.Results: Shows win/loss amount and new balance

Response Format.Public: Game results visible to all users

Response Format.Timeout: Notification if color not selected in time

commands.name: Sell
commands.description: Sell in-game items for coin currency.

steps: Use /sell to open the selling menu
Start a new sale by selecting 'Sell Items'
Place a fence kit at your desired sale location
Drop and destroy the items you want to sell
Wait for system to detect items or confirm manually
Receive coin payment upon confirmation
tutorial.notes: Cannot start sales within 1 hour of server restart. Must wait for items to despawn. Only specific items can be sold.

Menu Options.Confirm Sale: Verify detected items and complete sale

Menu Options.View Items: See list of sellable items and prices

Sale Requirements.Timing: Cannot sell within 1 hour of restart

Sale Requirements.Location: Must place fence kit as marker

Sale Requirements.Items: Must drop and destroy sellable items

Sale Process.Logging: All sales recorded with unique ID

Restrictions.Shop Purchases: Cannot sell while shop purchase pending

Restrictions.Item Types: Only specific items can be sold

commands.name: Settings
commands.description: Manage your personal server settings and preferences.

steps: Use /settings to open settings menu
Select setting to modify from dropdown
Follow prompts to change selected setting
Confirm changes when prompted
tutorial.notes: Settings menu expires after 120 seconds. Some options may be restricted based on your role.

commands.name: Shop
commands.description: Purchase and manage in-game items using coin currency.

steps: Use /shop to open the shopping menu
Browse categories or item kits
Add items to cart with desired quantities
Choose spawn location (fence kit or saved location)
Complete purchase and wait for next restart
tutorial.notes: Items spawn after server restart. Must be collected once to become protected by flags. Maximum 50 items per type.

Spawn Options.New Location: Place fence kit for new coordinates

commands.name: Slots
commands.description: Play slots with your coin currency.

steps: Use /slots followed by your bet amount
Watch the slot machine spin
Match symbols to win multipliers
Collect winnings or try again after cooldown
tutorial.notes: Maximum bet is 250 coin. Has cooldown between plays. Must be used in #workGamble channel.

Betting Rules.Balance: Cannot bet more than owned coin

Game Features.Results: Shows win/loss amount and new balance

Game Features.Public: Game results visible to all users

commands.name: Spawn
commands.description: Create and manage personal object spawns.

steps: Use /spawn to open spawn menu
Choose between new spawn or modify existing
Select object and location for new spawns
Manage existing spawns through modification options
tutorial.notes: Spawns must be 25 meters from other objects. Locations verified through status channel. 30-day duration with extension options.

commands.name: Stats
commands.description: View detailed player and Discord statistics.

steps: Use /stats followed by a subcommand
Choose between me/discord/player/pvprank
Provide required user or player name
View detailed statistics output
tutorial.notes: PVP rank card is generated with custom background and rank imagery. Stats are updated in real-time.

Subcommands.pvprank: View PVP rank card with visual display

PVP Statistics.Damage: Dealt and taken by weapon type

PVP Statistics.Rankings: Progressive rank system based on kills

commands.name: Suggest
commands.description: Create and manage server suggestions.

steps: Use /suggest new to create suggestion
Enter suggestion text (3000 char max)
Confirm submission for voting
Monitor votes and responses
tutorial.notes: Use 'newline' for line breaks. Default reactions include üëç and üëé. Additional reactions can be added after posting.

commands.name: Wire
commands.description: Transfer coin currency to other players.

steps: Use /wire command
Enter amount to send
@mention recipient
Confirm transaction
tutorial.notes: Cannot wire to bots, banned players, or yourself. Recipients must have linked accounts.

commands.name: Work
commands.description: Earn coin through random work activities.

steps: Use /work command
Receive random work scenario
Earn random coin amount
Wait for cooldown before next work
tutorial.notes: Cooldown between work sessions. Coin payout varies between 70% and 130% of base amount.

commands.name: Announce
commands.description: Tag online players with an announcement.

steps: Type /announce followed by your message
Enter the announcement message you want to send
Submit the command to send the announcement
The message will be sent to all online players
tutorial.notes: This command will tag all online players who have linked their Discord accounts

commands.name: Gate Codes
commands.description: View and manage gate codes for secure locations.

steps: Use /gatecodes to view all current gate codes
Select from available options: Add, Change, or Remove
Follow the prompts to manage gate codes
Confirm your changes when prompted
tutorial.notes: Requires Helper role. All codes must be 4 digits.

Main Options.Add: Create a new gate entry with code

Gate Management.Validation: Codes are verified for correct format

Interactive Menu.Navigation: Use dropdown menus to select options

Response Format.Organization: Lists gates with IDs and codes

commands.name: Bounty
commands.description: Start or end bounty contracts on players.

steps: Use /bounty followed by either 'new' or 'end' subcommand
For new bounty: Specify target player, objective, optional reward, and time limit
For ending bounty: Specify target and optionally the player who claimed it
Confirm the action when prompted
Bounty will be announced in the bounty log channel
tutorial.notes: Maximum reward is 2000 coins. Time limit is optional. Bounties can be cancelled if no one claims them.

Subcommands.new: Place a new bounty on a player

Subcommands.end: End or claim an existing bounty

Bounty Objectives.Shoot: Hit the target with a ranged weapon

Bounty Objectives.Melee: Hit the target with a melee weapon

Bounty Options.Claiming: Staff can assign bounty completion to specific players

commands.name: Mute
commands.description: Discord mute commands for managing user communication.

steps: Use /mute followed by a subcommand (add/remove/info)
For muting: /mute add @user reason [minutes]
For unmuting: /mute remove @user
For mute info: /mute info @user
tutorial.notes: Staff cannot mute users with equal or higher permissions. Permanent mutes can be set with 0 minutes.

Subcommands.add: Mute a user (requires target, reason, optional duration)

Subcommands.info: View details about a user's mute

Mute Options.Duration: Specify minutes (0 or omit for permanent)

Mute Options.Visibility: Mute actions are logged in admin channel

Permission Rules.Staff Hierarchy: Cannot mute users of equal/higher rank

Permission Rules.Unmute Rights: Cannot remove mutes placed by higher ranks

Information Display.Mute Details: Shows mute time, duration, and reason

Information Display.Time Tracking: Displays remaining time for temporary mutes

Information Display.Logging: All actions logged in admin channel

commands.name: Server
commands.description: Manage gameserver settings and configurations.

steps: Use /server followed by a subcommand
Select from available options or settings
Follow prompts to make changes
Confirm changes when prompted
tutorial.notes: Most settings require Staff or higher permissions. Some settings restricted to Discord Admin only.

Subcommands.draw-player-base: View base outline on Staff map (requires coordinates)

Subcommands.restart: Schedule server restart with optional delay

Subcommands.objects: View built objects in an area

Subcommands.objects-player: View all objects built by specific player

commands.name: Unlink
commands.description: Remove linked console account from Discord.

steps: Use /unlink command
Select console platform (Xbox/Playstation)
Enter player name to unlink
Confirm unlinking process
tutorial.notes: Staff command only. Used to manage player-Discord account connections.

Usage Details.Channels: Can be used in any channel

commands.name: Restart Bot
commands.description: Restarts the SpyZ bot.

steps: Type /admin restartbot in any allowed channel
Click 'Yes' to confirm the restart
Wait for confirmation message that bot is restarting
tutorial.notes: Make sure to notify users before restarting

commands.name: Bot Settings
commands.description: Modify core bot and server settings.

steps: Type /admin settings in an allowed channel
Select the setting you want to change from the dropdown menu
Follow the prompts to modify the selected setting
Confirm your changes when prompted
tutorial.notes: Some settings may require server restart to take effect

Player Management.Player Killers: Configure PVP rules (Strict Auto Ban/Player Ban/Allowed)

commands.name: iZurvive Map Settings
commands.description: Configure iZurvive map integration settings.

steps: Type /admin settings-izurvive in an allowed channel
Select the map setting you want to modify
Choose enable/disable or configure the selected option
Save your changes
tutorial.notes: Changes to map settings are applied immediately

commands.name: Shop Settings
commands.description: Manage shop items and currency configurations.

steps: Use /shop-settings followed by a subcommand
Choose between item or currency management
Enter required information for new entries
Confirm changes to update price lists
tutorial.notes: Administrator role required. Changes immediately update shop and currency lists in designated channels.

commands.name: XML
commands.description: Edit gameserver XML configuration files.

steps: Use /xml types to access type configurations
Select category to modify
Choose specific item type
Edit values or flags
Save changes to Nitrado server
tutorial.notes: Administrator role required. Changes require server restart to take effect. All modifications are logged.

commands.name: Grant
commands.description: Grant or remove coin from players or roles.

steps: Use /grant followed by the amount of coin
Either @mention a player OR @mention a role
Positive numbers add coin, negative numbers remove coin
Confirm the transaction in the response
tutorial.notes: Requires DiscordAdmin role. Cannot grant coin to banned players or bots. Players must have linked accounts.

Options.role: @Mention a role to affect all members (optional)

Requirements.Channel: Can only be used in #commands channel

Requirements.Target: Players must have linked game accounts

Requirements.Restrictions: Cannot target banned players or bots

Role Granting.Execution: Processes all members of mentioned role

Role Granting.Verification: Only affects members with valid accounts

Transaction Details.Logging: All transactions are logged in coin transactions channel

Transaction Details.Visibility: Command response is visible to all

commands.name: Server Dev
commands.description: Advanced server developer commands for system management.

steps: Use /serverdev followed by a subcommand
Confirm action in warning prompt
Wait for completion message
Check results after completion
tutorial.notes: These commands are high-risk and irreversible. Requires Discord Admin role. Use with extreme caution.

commands.name: Developer
commands.description: Developer commands for system maintenance.

steps: Use /developer followed by a subcommand
Select the desired maintenance operation
Wait for confirmation message
Check results in the response
tutorial.notes: This command requires Developer role and should be used with caution.

Subcommands.deploycommands: Deploy new command data to update Discord slash commands

Subcommands.cleanmembers: Remove inactive members from the Discord server

Usage.Channel Restriction: Can be used in any channel

Usage.Response: All responses are ephemeral (only visible to command user)

Operation Details.Deploy Commands: Updates all slash command registrations with Discord API

quickTips.Permission Check: Ensure you have the required role before attempting to use any command.

quickTips.Channel Restriction: Commands can only be used in designated command channels.

quickTips.Confirmation: Many settings will require confirmation before changes are applied.

quickTips.Timeout Warning: Settings menus will expire after 120 seconds of inactivity.
